result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J Hinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Jail], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to Winnebago County

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to seek/maintain employment

Not to consume illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia  Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional and use in the matter prescribed  No contact directly or indirectly with individuals in possession of controlled substances    Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription

Counseling/assessments deemed appropriate  If Probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

timeConds.notes: May be served in Winnebago County

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
